summary: This bill, H.R. 3172, aims to amend the Immigration and Nationality Act. It mandates that U.S. immigration officers, including those from Customs and Border Protection and Immigration and Customs Enforcement, visibly display identification during immigration enforcement actions. This identification must clearly state the officer's agency, be a specific size (12x6 inches), and not be covered by uniform accessories. The bill defines “time of action” to include various enforcement activities.
